  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.04%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our 143 supermarkets have total square
footage of approximately 7.5 million square feet with an aggregate selling area
of approximately 5.5 million square feet.&#160;
Fifteen of these stores are owned and the remaining 128 are leased.&#160; These supermarkets are either freestanding stores
or are located in shopping centers.&#160;
Fifty-one leases will expire through fiscal 2008 and there are options
to renew 50 of them.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">9</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='9',FILE='C:\jms\mnguye\04-4196-1\task107369\4196-1-ba.htm',USER='mnguyenb',CD='Apr  8 11:12 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We lease our corporate headquarters in
Carteret, New Jersey in premises totaling approximately 150,000 square feet in
size.&#160; Our lease will expire in fiscal
2011.&#160; We have five five-year options
remaining on this property.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">All of the facilities owned by us are subject
to mortgages.&#160; We plan to acquire
leasehold or fee interests in any property on which new stores or other
facilities are opened and will consider entering into sale-leaseback or
mortgage transactions with respect to owned properties if we believe such
transactions are financially advantageous.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We operate a 290,000 square foot leased
general merchandise and health and beauty care products distribution center in
Edison, New Jersey.&#160; Our lease will
expire in fiscal 2009.&#160; We have two
five-year options remaining on this property.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item
3.&#160; Legal Proceedings</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We are subject to claims and suits against us
in the ordinary cause of our business.&#160;
While the outcome of these claims cannot be predicted with certainty, we
do not believe that the outcome of any of these legal matters will have a
material adverse effect on our results of operations, financial position or
cash flows.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item
4.&#160; Submission of Matters to a Vote of
Security Holders</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">None.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>


<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left">

</font></div>


<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">*&#160; Unless otherwise indicated,
all information in Item 2 is given as of January 31, 2004.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">10</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Executive
Officers of the Registrant</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following
table sets forth the name, age as of March 15, 2004, principal occupation or
employment in the present time and during the last five years, and the name of
any corporation or other organization in which such occupation or employment is
or was conducted, of our executive officers, all of whom are citizens of the
United States and serve at the discretion of our Board of Directors.&#160; Our executive officers listed below were
elected to office for an indefinite period of time.&#160; No family relationship exists between any executive officer and
any other executive officer or director.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Part II</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item
5.&#160;&#160; Market for the Registrant&#146;s Common
Equity and Related Stockholder Matters</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Market for Common Stock.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Common stock and warrants are currently
trading on the Nasdaq National Market under the ticker symbols &#147;PTMK&#148; and
&#147;PTMKW&#148;, respectively.&#160; The following
table represents the high and low closing prices for our common stock for each
quarter in the two fiscal years ended January 31, 2004, as reported by the
Nasdaq National Market.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="75%" style="border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:.5in;width:75.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="58%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:58.78%;">
  <p align="center" style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-align:center;text-indent:-10.0pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.04%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.08%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>

  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Low</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.0%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
 </tr>

  <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Fiscal 2003</font></u>:</i></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.04%;">

  </td>

 <tr>
  <td width="58%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:58.78%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1<sup>st</sup> quarter</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.04%;">

  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.72%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:16.34%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">7.48</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.08%;">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Holders of Record.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; As of March 15, 2004, there were 46 holders
of record of our common stock; however, over 99% of the Company&#146;s outstanding
common stock is held in &#147;street name&#148; by depositories or nominees on behalf of
beneficial holders.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Dividends.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; We paid no cash dividends to our stockholders
and do not currently anticipate paying cash dividends during fiscal 2004.&#160; We are prohibited from paying cash dividends
to holders of our common stock under terms of our credit agreement dated
September 19, 2000 with a group of lenders led by JPMorgan Chase Bank (the
&#147;Credit Agreement&#148;).&#160; We are restricted
from paying cash dividends to holders of our common stock under the indenture
governing our $350 million 8.75% Senior Subordinated Notes, due 2012 (the &#147;Senior
Subordinated Notes&#148;).</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">12</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item
6.&#160;&#160; Selected Financial Data</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Summary of Historical Consolidated Financial
and Other Data</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following table presents selected
historical consolidated financial and other data.&#160; The periods prior to our exit from bankruptcy have been
designated &#147;Predecessor Company&#148; and the periods subsequent to that date have
been designated &#147;Successor Company.&#148;&#160;
The statement of operations data for the 52 weeks ended January 31,
2004, February 1, 2003 and February 2, 2002 and the balance sheet data as of
January 31, 2004 and February 1, 2003 are derived from our audited consolidated
financial statements included elsewhere in this report.&#160; The statement of operations data for the 20
weeks ended February 3, 2001, the 33 weeks ended September 16, 2000 and the 52
weeks ended January 29, 2000 and the balance sheet data as of February 2, 2002,
February 3, 2001 and January 29, 2000 are derived from our audited financial
statements not included in this report.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following table (in millions, except per
share amounts) should be read in conjunction with &#147;Management&#146;s Discussion and
Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations&#148; and our consolidated
financial statements included elsewhere in this report:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="32%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:32.84%;">
  <p align="center" style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-align:center;text-indent:-10.0pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.96%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="41%" colspan="11" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:41.1%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Successor
  Company (a)</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-right:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.78%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="20%" colspan="5" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:20.2%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Predecessor
  Company (a)</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.14%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="32%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:32.84%;">
  <p align="center" style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-align:center;text-indent:-10.0pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.96%;">

  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;">$</font></p>

  <td width="55" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="12" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="15" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="53" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="18" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="15" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="49" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="14" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="14" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="51" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="21" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="10" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="61" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="18" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="18" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="42" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="11" style="border:none;"></td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Notes to Summary of Historical Consolidated
Financial and Other Data</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We completed our plan of
reorganization (the &#147;Plan of Reorganization&#148;) and formally exited Chapter 11 on
September 19, 2000 (the &#147;Plan Effective Date&#148;).&#160; Pursuant to our Plan of Reorganization, our direct and indirect
parent companies merged with us and we became the surviving entity.&#160; These mergers are being accounted for in the
historical financial statements at historical cost in a manner similar to
pooling-of-interests accounting.&#160; As a
result, we adopted fresh-start reporting in accordance with American Institute
of Certified Public Accountants Statement of Position 90-7, &#147;Financial
Reporting By Entities in Reorganization Under the Bankruptcy Code&#148; (&#147;Fresh-Start
Reporting&#148;).&#160; In connection with the
adoption of Fresh-Start Reporting, a new entity had been deemed created for
financial reporting purposes.&#160; The
periods presented prior to the Plan Effective Date have been designated
&#147;Predecessor Company&#148; and the periods subsequent to the Plan Effective Date
have been designated &#147;Successor Company&#148; with September 16, 2000, the Saturday
nearest the Plan Effective Date, utilized for the accounting closing date
related to the Predecessor Company financial statements.&#160; As a result of the implementation of
Fresh-Start Reporting and the substantial debt reduction from the completion of
our Plan of Reorganization, the results of operations and balance sheets of the
Successor Company and the Predecessor Company are not comparable.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(b)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Selling, general and
administrative expenses in fiscal 2003 are net of a $13.7 million gain from the
disposition of real estate related to the assignment of two real estate leases
and includes a charge of $8.1 million related to our store labor buyout
initiative and corporate headcount reduction program, which was commenced and
completed during the first six months of fiscal 2003, in order to reduce labor
costs.&#160; The aforementioned $8.1 million
charge included a $2.0 million charge funded by our qualified pension
plan.&#160; Of the $8.1 million charge, $7.3
million is attributable to the cost of a voluntary early retirement program and
$0.8 million is attributable to severance and termination benefits.&#160; As of January 31, 2004, $0.7 million of
benefits related to the store labor buyout initiative and corporate headcount
reduction program remain to be paid out over time.&#160; Fiscal 2002 included a $2.0 million charge related to a store
labor buyout program.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(c)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Successor Company&#146;s
reorganization income of $7.4 million for the 20 weeks ended February 3, 2001
represented a gain related to the difference between the settled lessor claims
for rejected leases and the liability previously recorded for such claims.&#160; In the 33 weeks ended September 16, 2000,
the Predecessor Company&#146;s reorganization income of $359.4 million represented
income from the cancellation of debt related to the exchange of bond
indebtedness, accrued interest for common stock and warrants in accordance with
the Plan of Reorganization</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">14</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='14',FILE='C:\jms\mnguye\04-4196-1\task107369\4196-1-ba.htm',USER='mnguyenb',CD='Apr  8 11:12 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">and a gain related to the difference between
the estimated lessor claims for rejected leases and the liabilities previously
recorded for such leases; such income was reduced by the write off of deferred financing
costs related to the former bank credit facility and bond indebtedness subject
to change, and the cost of employee retention bonuses and professional fees
related to legal, accounting and consulting services directly attributable to
the Plan of Reorganization.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Reorganization income of $359.4 million in
the 33 weeks ended September 16, 2000, previously classified as an
extraordinary item, has been reclassified within income from operations to
retroactively reflect the adoption on February 2, 2002 of the Financial
Accounting Standards Board (the &#147;FASB&#148;) Statement of Financial Accounting
Standards (&#147;SFAS&#148;) No. 145, &#147;Rescission of FASB Statements No. 4, 44 and 64,
Amendment of FASB Statement No. 13, and Technical Corrections.&#148;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(d)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Goodwill of $798.0 million,
resulting from Fresh-Start Reporting, was being amortized over three
years.&#160; In accordance with SFAS No. 142,
&#147;Goodwill and Other Intangible Assets&#148;, the Company&#146;s goodwill account is no
longer being amortized subsequent to fiscal 2001 but rather is being evaluated
for impairment annually, or more frequently if events or changes in
circumstances indicate that the asset might be impaired.&#160; We adopted SFAS No. 142 effective with the
beginning of fiscal 2002.&#160; Based on an
independent evaluation of our fair value completed when SFAS No. 142 was
adopted in the first quarter of fiscal 2002, we concluded that there was no
impairment of our goodwill.&#160; We
performed our annual evaluation of goodwill in the fourth quarters of fiscal
2003 and fiscal 2002, and, based on this independent evaluation, concluded that
there was no impairment of our goodwill.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(e)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Interest expense in fiscal
2003 included a derivative settlement charge of $3.7 million related to the
termination and settlement of our $150 million interest rate zero-cost collar
and the write off of deferred financing costs of $2.1 million as a result of
the repayment of $153 million of our term loan primarily from proceeds from the
issuance of an additional $150 million ($100 million on September 19, 2003 and
$50 million on December 18, 2003) aggregate principal amount of Senior
Subordinated Notes.&#160; Interest expense in
fiscal 2003 also included the write off of deferred financing costs of $0.5
million as a result of the repayment in the second quarter of fiscal 2003 of
$18 million of our term loan.&#160; Interest
expense in fiscal 2002 included the reversal of an accrued interest liability
of $2.2 million related to the favorable resolution of certain tax issues.&#160; Interest expense in fiscal 2001 included
$5.6 million related to the early extinguishment of debt, previously classified
as an extraordinary item, to retroactively reflect the adoption on February 2,
2002 of SFAS No. 145.&#160; As a result of
our Chapter 11 filing on July 12, 2000, the &#147;Petition Date&#148;, no principal or
interest payments were made on or after the Petition Date on our subordinated
debt.&#160; Accordingly, no interest expense
for such subordinated debt has been accrued on or after the Petition Date.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(f)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company adopted, as of
the beginning of fiscal 2002, Emerging Issues Task Force (&#147;EITF&#148;) Issue No.
02-16, &#147;Accounting by a Customer (Including a Reseller) for Certain
Consideration Received from a Vendor.&#148;&#160;
In adopting EITF Issue No. 02-16, vendor payments related to advertising
reimbursements are recorded as a reduction of cost of goods sold when both the
required advertising is performed and the inventory is sold; prior to this
change, these reimbursements were recorded as a reduction of advertising
expense when the required advertising was performed.&#160; As a result, we recorded a charge, as of the first quarter of
fiscal 2002, of $0.6 million, net of an income tax benefit of $0.4 million, for
the cumulative effect of an accounting change.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(g)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The weighted-average number
of shares outstanding &#150; basic were 30.1 million shares for fiscal 2003 and for
fiscal 2002 and 30.0 million shares for fiscal 2001 and for the 20 weeks ended
February 3, 2001.&#160; The weighted-average
number of shares outstanding &#150; diluted were 30.4 million shares for fiscal 2003
and for fiscal 2002 and 30.0 million shares for fiscal 2001 and for the 20
weeks ended February 3, 2001.&#160; For
fiscal 2001 and for the 20 weeks ended February 3, 2001, all stock options,
warrants and restricted stock were excluded from the computation of weighted-average
number of shares outstanding &#150; diluted because their effect would have been
anti-diluted.&#160; Data is not presented for
the Predecessor Company due to the significant change in our capital structure.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">15</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='15',FILE='C:\jms\mnguye\04-4196-1\task107369\4196-1-ba.htm',USER='mnguyenb',CD='Apr  8 11:12 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item
7.&#160;&#160; Management&#146;s Discussion and
Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">General</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We are a leading supermarket chain in the
densely populated New York &#150; New Jersey and Philadelphia metropolitan areas,
operating 143 supermarkets. &#160;These
metropolitan areas contain over 10% of the population in the United
States.&#160; All of our supermarkets are
located within 100 miles of our corporate headquarters in Carteret, New Jersey
and our Company-operated and outsourced distribution facilities. &#160;We design our stores to provide customers
with &#147;one-stop&#148; shopping with a wide assortment of foods and general
merchandise, as well as additional conveniences, including 130 in-store
full-service pharmacies and a wide array of financial services offered by 83
in-store banks.&#160; We are a leading filler
of prescriptions among our supermarket competitors in the New York &#150; New Jersey
and Philadelphia metropolitan areas and, through our agreements with Fleet Bank
and New York Community Bank, we believe we are the leading provider of in-store
banking services in our market area.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our sales are derived from the retail sale of
products at our stores. Internally, we look to a variety of indicators to
evaluate our sales and gross profit performance, including, among others:
comparable store sales; sales per store; sales per selling square foot;
percentage of total sales by department; shrink and department margins. In
fiscal 2003, we continued to focus on increasing comparable store sales, sales
per selling square foot and sales per store through programs focused on greater
customer service and better store-level execution and merchandising, as well as
a continued focus on our high sanitation standards.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our operating expenses are primarily incurred
from selling, general and administrative costs.&#160; Over 70% of these costs are for labor and labor-related
benefits.&#160; Internally, we focus on a
variety of indicators to evaluate our expense performance, including, among
others: labor costs, including labor hours and hourly labor rates and
labor-related costs such as pension and welfare costs, workers&#146; compensation
costs and payroll taxes.&#160; In fiscal
2003, we continued to focus on controlling labor costs through a labor buyout
initiative and implementation of a new time and attendance system.&#160; Selling, general and administrative expenses
other than labor and labor-related costs include occupancy expenses, supplies
and customer accident claims, among others.&#160;
In fiscal 2003, we continued to focus on other expense control
initiatives through our Best Ball and Focus Store programs in which best
operating practices are implemented throughout our chain.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Major initiatives currently in place or
implemented during fiscal 2003 include:</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.15in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our advertising
week was changed to begin on Friday resulting in more effective marketing.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.15in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Store labor
buyout initiative and corporate headcount reduction program resulting in
reduced labor costs.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.15in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;Best Ball&#148;
program to identify best operating practices and implement these throughout our
chain.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.15in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;Focus Stores&#148;
program in which stores identified as having significant upside opportunities
are mentored by members of senior management.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.15in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mystery shopper
program to evaluate and improve customer service.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.15in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Store-level
audits of food safety and sanitation.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.15in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Investments in
technology, including a new time and attendance system, a multi-year upgrade to
our merchandising system and the continuing leverage of our existing systems
for increased productivity.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.15in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Debt reduction
through effective asset management.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We believe these programs, together with
overall operational improvements, resulted in increased sales metrics and
improved productivity in fiscal 2003 and will continue to increase sales and
improve productivity. These gains were largely offset by increases in pension
and welfare costs, a trend we expect to continue.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As has been our practice in the past, we will
continue to evaluate the profitability, strategic positioning, impact of
potential competition, and sales growth potential of all our stores on an
ongoing basis. We may, from time to time, make decisions regarding closures,
relocations or renovations in accordance with such evaluations. During fiscal
2003, we opened two new stores of which one was a replacement store, closed two
stores and renovated 16 stores. During fiscal 2004, we plan to open two stores,
close one store and renovate 20 stores.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">16</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.24%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="16%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:16.64%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1.2</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:2.74%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:14.46%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1.7</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:2.84%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)%</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="61%" valign="top" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:61.08%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Sales per selling square foot</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.24%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.56%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="15%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:15.08%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">734</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.74%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.08%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.38%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">724</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.84%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr height="0">
  <td width="440" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="16" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="11" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="109" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="20" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="15" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="89" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="20" style="border:none;"></td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Sales in fiscal 2003 were $3.99 billion
compared to $3.94 billion in fiscal 2002, an increase of 1.4%.&#160; The sales increase in fiscal 2003 was primarily
due to higher same-store sales (stores open the entire year in both fiscal 2003
and fiscal 2002, including replacement stores and enlargements) of 1.2% and new
stores, partially offset by closed stores.&#160;
We believe sales benefited from our successful marketing and operations
initiatives, including the change in the start of our weekly ad at the
beginning of fiscal 2003.&#160; Sales were
also favorably impacted by increased customer shopping preceding several major
snowstorms in the first quarter of fiscal 2003.&#160; During fiscal 2003, we opened two stores of which one was a
replacement store, closed two stores and renovated 16 stores.&#160; We operated 143 stores and 144 stores at the
end of fiscal 2003 and fiscal 2002, respectively.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Gross Profit.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Gross profit represents the difference
between sales and cost of goods sold, which includes the costs of inventory
sold and the related purchase and distribution costs, net of vendor allowances
and rebates.&#160; Gross profit in fiscal
2003 was $1.14 billion or 28.5% of sales compared to $1.12 billion or 28.5% of
sales for fiscal 2002.&#160; The increase in
gross profit dollars for fiscal 2003 compared to fiscal 2002 was primarily due
to higher sales.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Selling, General and
Administrative Expenses (&#147;SG&amp;A&#148;).</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; SG&amp;A in fiscal 2003 was $953.9 million or 23.9% of sales
compared to $944.4 million or 24.0% of sales in fiscal 2002.&#160; SG&amp;A in fiscal 2003 includes higher
medical, workers&#146; compensation and pension expenses, as well as higher snow removal
costs in the first quarter of fiscal 2003 and higher occupancy expenses,
primarily associated with new stores, partially offset by lower payroll
expenses resulting from the store labor buyout and corporate headcount
reduction programs implemented in fiscal 2003.&#160;
SG&amp;A in fiscal 2003 also included an $8.1 million charge related to
the Company&#146;s aforementioned store labor buyout initiative and corporate
headcount reduction program during the first and second quarters of fiscal
2003, and is net of a $13.7 million gain from the disposition of real estate
related to the assignment of two real estate leases.&#160; Fiscal 2002 included a $2.0 million charge related to a labor
buyout program.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">17</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='17',FILE='C:\jms\mnguye\04-4196-1\task107369\4196-1-ba.htm',USER='mnguyenb',CD='Apr  8 11:12 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Depreciation and
Amortization.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160;
Depreciation and amortization of $84.0 million in fiscal 2003 was $0.6
million lower than the $84.6 million in fiscal 2002.&#160; The decrease in depreciation and amortization expense in fiscal
2003 compared to fiscal 2002 was primarily due to a decrease in capital
expenditures since fiscal 2001.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Operating Earnings.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Operating earnings were $100.8 million, or
2.5% of sales, in fiscal 2003 compared to $92.0 million, or 2.3% of sales, in
fiscal 2002.&#160; The increase in operating
earnings in fiscal 2003 compared to fiscal 2002 was primarily due to higher
gross profit, partially offset by higher SG&amp;A expenses.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Interest Expense.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Interest expense was $72.5 million in fiscal
2003 compared to $65.1 million in fiscal 2002.&#160;
The increase in interest expense in fiscal 2003 compared to fiscal 2002
was primarily due to a derivative settlement charge of $3.7 million related to
the termination and settlement of our $150 million interest rate zero-cost
collar, the write off of deferred financing costs of $2.1 million as a result
of the repayment of $153 million of our term loan primarily from proceeds from
the issuance of an additional $150 million ($100 million on September 19, 2003
and $50 million on December 18, 2003) aggregate principal amount of Senior
Subordinated Notes.&#160; Interest expense in
fiscal 2003 also included the write off of deferred financing costs of $0.5
million as a result of the repayment in the second quarter of fiscal 2003 of
$18 million of our term loan and an increased interest rate as a result of the
January 28, 2003 amendment to our Credit Agreement.&#160; Fiscal 2002 included the reversal of an accrued interest
liability of $2.2 million related to the favorable resolution of certain tax
issues.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Income Tax Provision.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; The income tax provision of $11.8 million in
fiscal 2003 was based on an effective tax rate of 41.6% and the income tax
provision of $13.0 million in fiscal 2002 was based on an effective income tax
rate of 39.6%.&#160; During fiscal 2003, we
made income tax payments of $6.1 million.&#160;
During fiscal 2002, we made income tax payments of $4.1 million and
received income tax refunds of $2.6 million.&#160;
Refer to Note 17 of the consolidated financial statements for
information related to our income taxes.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Cumulative Effect of an
Accounting Change.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; We adopted,
as of the beginning of fiscal 2002, EITF Issue No. 02-16, &#147;Accounting by a
Customer (Including a Reseller) for Certain Consideration Received from a
Vendor&#148;.&#160; In adopting EITF Issue No.
02-16, vendor payments related to advertising reimbursements are recorded as a
reduction of cost of goods sold when both the required advertising is performed
and the inventory is sold; prior to this change, these reimbursements were
recorded as a reduction of advertising expense when the required advertising
was performed.&#160; As a result, we recorded
a charge, as of the first quarter of fiscal 2002, of $0.6 million, net of an
income tax benefit of $0.4 million, for the cumulative effect of an accounting
change.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Summary of Operations.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Net earnings in fiscal 2003 were $16.5
million compared to $13.3 million in fiscal 2002.&#160; The increase in net earnings in fiscal 2003 compared to fiscal
2002 was primarily due to increased operating earnings, partially offset by
higher interest expense.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">18</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Fiscal
2002 Compared to Fiscal 2001</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.7%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3,963.3</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(16.2</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.66%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(0.4</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:2.32%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="43%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:43.02%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Earnings (loss) before cumulative effect of
  an accounting change</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">13.9</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.32%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">0.3</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.68%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(242.0</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.66%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(6.1</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:2.32%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="43%" valign="top" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:43.02%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Cumulative effect of an accounting change,
  net of tax</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(0.6</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.32%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-family:Symbol;font-size:10.0pt;">&#190;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.68%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-family:Symbol;font-size:10.0pt;">&#190;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.66%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-family:Symbol;font-size:10.0pt;">&#190;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.32%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="43%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:43.02%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net earnings (loss)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.7%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">13.3</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.32%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">0.3</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:2.68%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.7%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(242.0</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.66%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(6.1</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:2.32%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)%</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Sales.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Sales in fiscal 2002 were $3.94 billion
compared to $3.96 billion in fiscal 2001, a decrease of 0.6%.&#160; The sales decrease in fiscal 2002 was
primarily due to lower same-store sales (stores opened the entire year in both
fiscal 2002 and fiscal 2001, including replacement stores and enlargements) of
1.7% and closed stores, partially offset by new store sales.&#160; We believe sales were negatively impacted by
weak economic conditions and declining consumer confidence in our region and its
resultant effect on consumer spending.&#160;
These same conditions resulted in increased promotional activity within
our marketplace.&#160; During fiscal 2002, we
opened seven stores (including one former Grand Union store we purchased in
fiscal 2001) of which three were replacement stores, closed one store and
renovated 11 stores.&#160; We operated 144
and 141 stores at the end of fiscal 2002 and fiscal 2001, respectively.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Gross Profit.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Gross profit represents the difference
between sales and cost of goods sold, which includes the costs of inventory
sold and the related purchase and distribution costs, net of vendor allowances
and rebates.&#160; Gross profit in fiscal
2002 was $1.12 billion or 28.5% of sales compared to $1.11 billion or 27.9% of
sales for fiscal 2001.&#160; The increase in
gross profit of $13.3 million for fiscal 2002 compared to fiscal 2001 was
primarily due to the impact of EITF Issue No. 02-16, in which vendor payments
of $17.7 million in fiscal 2002 related to advertising reimbursements,
previously classified as a reduction of SG&amp;A, were reclassified as a
reduction of cost of goods sold.&#160;
Excluding this reclassification, the decrease in gross profit of $4.4
million for fiscal 2002 compared to fiscal 2001 was due to lower sales and
higher shrink, partially offset by higher vendor allowances and rebates.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">SG&amp;A.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; SG&amp;A in fiscal 2002 increased $24.0
million or 2.6% compared to fiscal 2001.&#160;
This increase in SG&amp;A was primarily due to the impact of EITF Issue
No. 02-16, in which payments of $17.7 million in fiscal 2002 related to
advertising reimbursements, previously classified as a reduction of SG&amp;A,
were reclassified as a reduction of cost of goods sold.&#160; Excluding this reclassification, SG&amp;A
increased $6.3 million in fiscal 2002 compared to fiscal 2001 due to higher
store costs related to labor, union health and welfare contributions and rent,
partially offset by lower administrative expenses and favorable customer
accident claims expense.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">19</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='19',FILE='C:\jms\mnguye\04-4196-1\task107369\4196-1-ba.htm',USER='mnguyenb',CD='Apr  8 11:12 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Depreciation and
Amortization.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160;
Depreciation and amortization of $84.6 million in fiscal 2002 was $7.9
million higher than the $76.7 million in fiscal 2001.&#160; The increase in depreciation and amortization expense in fiscal
2002 compared to fiscal 2001 was primarily due to the impact of our stepped-up
capital program and technology initiatives.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Amortization of Goodwill.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; The Company adopted SFAS No. 142 effective
with the beginning of fiscal 2002.&#160; With
the adoption of SFAS No. 142, goodwill is no longer being amortized but rather
is being evaluated for impairment at least annually.&#160; Amortization of goodwill was $265.5 million in fiscal 2001.&#160; Based on an independent evaluation of its
fair value completed when SFAS No. 142 was adopted in the first quarter of
fiscal 2002, the Company concluded that there was no impairment of its
goodwill.&#160; The Company performed its
annual evaluation of its goodwill in the fourth quarter of fiscal 2002, and,
based on this independent evaluation of its fair value, concluded that there
was no impairment of its goodwill.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Operating Earnings (Loss).</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Operating earnings were $92.0 million in
fiscal 2002 compared to an operating loss of $154.9 million in fiscal
2001.&#160; The increase in operating
earnings in fiscal 2002 compared to an operating loss in fiscal 2001 was
primarily due to the elimination of goodwill amortization in fiscal 2002
compared to the amortization of goodwill of $265.5 million in fiscal 2001.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Interest Expense.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Interest expense was $65.1 million in fiscal
2002 compared to $70.9 million in fiscal 2001.&#160;
Fiscal 2002 included the reversal of an accrued interest liability of
$2.2 million related to the favorable resolution of certain tax issues.&#160; Interest expense in fiscal 2001 included
$5.6 million related to the early extinguishment of debt, previously classified
as an extraordinary item, to retroactively reflect the adoption on February 2,
2002 of SFAS No. 145.&#160; Excluding the
reversal of the accrued interest liability in fiscal 2002 and the early
extinguishment of debt in fiscal 2001, the increase in interest expense in
fiscal 2002 compared to fiscal 2001 was primarily due to higher borrowings.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Income Tax Provision.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; The income tax provision was $13.0 million
and $16.2 million in fiscal 2002 and fiscal 2001, respectively.&#160; During fiscal 2002, we made income tax
payments of $4.1 million and received income tax refunds of $2.6 million.&#160; During fiscal 2001, we made income tax
payments of $1.0 million.&#160; Refer to Note
17 of the consolidated financial statements for information related to our
income taxes.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Cumulative Effect of an
Accounting Change.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; The Company
adopted, as of the beginning of fiscal 2002, EITF Issue No. 02-16, &#147;Accounting
by a Customer (Including a Reseller) for Certain Consideration Received from a
Vendor&#148;.&#160; In adopting EITF Issue No.
02-16, vendor payments related to advertising reimbursements are recorded as a
reduction of cost of goods sold when both the required advertising is performed
and the inventory is sold; prior to this change, these reimbursements were
recorded as a reduction of advertising expense when the required advertising
was performed.&#160; As a result, we recorded
a charge, as of the first quarter of fiscal 2002, of $0.6 million, net of an
income tax benefit of $0.4 million, for the cumulative effect of an accounting
change.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Summary of Operations.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Net earnings in fiscal 2002 were $13.3
million compared to a net loss of $242.0 million in fiscal 2001.&#160; The increase in net earnings in fiscal 2002
compared to a net loss in fiscal 2001 was primarily due to lower operating
earnings.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Liquidity
and Capital Resources</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Cash Flows.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; The following table sets forth certain
consolidated statements of cash flow data (in millions):</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
